Hi,

I didn't read the entire thread regarding the "Programming By Contract" but 
I thought the following links might be of interest to the discussions :

"The Contract Pattern", in Java (maybe the "The" should be "A"):
http://st-www.cs.uiuc.edu/users/hanmer/PLoP-97/Proceedings/dechamplain.pdf

Info regarding new java (1.4) "assert" keyword :
http://java.sun.com/aboutJava/communityprocess/jsr/jsr_041_asrt.html
&
http://java.sun.com/aboutJava/communityprocess/review/jsr041/publicDraft.html
And on the Junit sourceforge forums (re:future of Junit wrt assert keyword 
introduction):
http://sourceforge.net/forum/forum.php?thread_id=66350&forum_id=48542

More of that kind of stuff @
http://www.designbycontract.com/basics/articles.html

I think there is confusion regarding the fact that there might be 2 uses of 
the Assert utility class : asserts in [unit] tests and asserts in a design 
by contract strategy. The handling of the 2 categories, and the related 
exceptions that should be thrown, would need to differ.

my $0.02
Mathieu
